description.@value: You might never go back to the traditional kind...

recipeIngredient.@value: 1 (1.5 oz.) bar milk, semi-sweet or dark chocolate
raw or turbinado sugar, optional, for dusting

recipeInstructions.@value:
Preheat oven to 375º F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
							Take 1 sheet of pie dough and lay it gently over ice cube tray.
							Working carefully, gently use your knuckles to loosely press the pie dough into the ice cube molds.
							Place one marshmallow in each mold, then top with 1 square of chocolate.
							Lay remaining pie crust on top of ice cube tray and use a rolling pin to seal all the edges together.
							Once edges are sealed, use a paring knife or kitchen shears to trim away any excess dough.
							Flip ice cube tray over and gently remove mini s’mores pies. Cut in between “pies” and transfer each one to lined baking sheet.
							Brush each pie with melted butter then sprinkle sugar on top.
							Place in oven and bake for 20-22 minutes, or until golden.
							Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes before serving. Enjoy!

text.@value: Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes before serving. Enjoy!
Take 1 sheet of pie dough and lay it gently over ice cube tray.
Preheat oven to 375º F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Lay remaining pie crust on top of ice cube tray and use a rolling pin to seal all the edges together.
Once edges are sealed, use a paring knife or kitchen shears to trim away any excess dough.
Flip ice cube tray over and gently remove mini s’mores pies. Cut in between “pies” and transfer each one to lined baking sheet.
Working carefully, gently use your knuckles to loosely press the pie dough into the ice cube molds.
Place in oven and bake for 20-22 minutes, or until golden.
Place one marshmallow in each mold, then top with 1 square of chocolate.
Brush each pie with melted butter then sprinkle sugar on top.
